meanings.definition: A loud, resonant sound or noise.
meanings.sent1: The clangers of the thunder scared the little dog.
meanings.sent2: The clangers of the bells filled the air with music.
meanings.sent3: The clangers of the pots and pans clashing together made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The clangers of the fireworks echoed through the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The clangers of the construction work could be heard from miles away.

meanings.sent1: Making clangers in a speech can be embarrassing.
meanings.sent2: She realized her clangers during the exam and felt anxious.
meanings.sent3: His clangers in the game cost his team the victory.
meanings.sent4: The clangers in the recipe turned the cake into a disaster.
meanings.sent5: Avoiding clangers in your work will lead to success.

meanings.definition: A metal object that makes a loud noise when struck.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith's clangers rang out in the workshop.
meanings.sent2: The clangers on the wind chime created a soothing melody.
meanings.sent3: The clangers on the old clock chimed every hour.
meanings.sent4: The clangers on the gate alerted us to visitors.
meanings.sent5: The clangers on the tambourine added rhythm to the music.
